main event: A civilian observed a star-like object in the sky resembling the size of Mars, which hovered and moved erratically for about 15 minutes in the southern sky in Bethesda, Maryland on July 20, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as star-like, with a reddish yellow color and a slight luminous trail.
It was observed by a civilian who was pointing at stars and planets to his son at the time of sighting.
The object's erratic movement was compared to smoke in a circle, starting and stopping intermittently.
The observation lasted for approximately 15 minutes, with the object remaining in the same area.
The conclusion of the report suggested possible explanations including a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object, but ultimately classified the object as unknown.
sighted object: star-like object resembling the size of Mars
